page.title: Mood & Social
page.subtitle: How Kava elevates mood, creates euphoria, and promotes social interactions.

einfuehrung.paragraph1: Kava is not just a relaxant – it is a social drink. For thousands of years, it has been consumed in the Pacific during ceremonies, gatherings, and social occasions. Its mood-lifting and socially opening effects make it a unique "social lubricant" – without the downsides of alcohol.
einfuehrung.paragraph2: The effects are often described as euphoria without intoxication: One feels good, open, and talkative, while maintaining full control and mental clarity.

mechanismen.title: Neurobiological Foundations
mechanismen.intro: The mood-enhancing effect of Kava is based on several neurobiological mechanisms that go beyond mere GABA modulation.

items.title: Dopamine System
items.text: Some Kavalactones, especially Yangonin (6) and Desmethoxyyangonin (1), show interactions with dopamine receptors. Dopamine is the "reward neurotransmitter" and is responsible for motivation, joy, and well-being. This interaction explains the mood-lifting and slightly euphoric effects.

items.title: Endocannabinoid System
items.text: Yangonin has a proven affinity for the CB1 receptor of the endocannabinoid system. This explains the slightly euphoric, relaxing effect that some users compare to a mild cannabis-like feeling – but without the psychedelic component and with full clarity.

items.title: MAO-B Inhibition
items.text: Especially Desmethoxyyangonin inhibits the enzyme monoamine oxidase-B (MAO-B). This slows the breakdown of dopamine in the brain and prolongs its effects. The result: sustained good mood and a sense of well-being.

items.title: Norepinephrine Modulation
items.text: Inhibition of norepinephrine reuptake contributes to a feeling of alert attention. One is relaxed but not tired – ideal for conversations and social interactions.

quote.text: Some Kavalactones (especially Yangonin and Desmethoxyyangonin) show interactions with dopamine and norepinephrine receptors – this can promote mood-lifting, motivating effects.

euphorie.title: The Kava Euphoria
euphorie.intro: The euphoric component of Kava is subtle but distinctly noticeable. It fundamentally differs from the euphoria induced by alcohol or other substances.

kava.title: Kava Euphoria
items: ✅ No disinhibition or loss of control

alcohol.title: Alcohol Euphoria
items: ❌ Can turn into aggression or sadness

euphorie.description: The Kava euphoria is often described as "contented serenity". One feels good in their skin, accepts the situation as it is, and has a natural interest in other people. Worries and ruminations fade into the background.

sozial.title: Social Effects
sozial.intro: In the Pacific Islands, Kava is the social drink par excellence. It is consumed at gatherings, peace negotiations, weddings, and everyday meetings. The social effect is a central aspect of the Kava experience.

kavaBar.title: The Kava Bar Culture
kavaBar.text: In the USA and increasingly in Europe, Kava Bars are emerging as an alternative to alcohol bars. The atmosphere is typically quieter and conversation-oriented. Instead of loud music and disinhibition, one finds deep conversations and genuine connections. Many people who do not wish to drink alcohol find a social alternative here.

quote.text: The effects are not intoxicating but centering, calming, and connecting. The combination with mindful settings (e.g., music, candlelight, natural surroundings) seems to deepen the effect.

chemotypen.title: Recommended Chemotypes & Varieties
chemotypen.intro: For mood-lifting and social effects, "Heady" varieties with high levels of Kavain and Yangonin are ideal. These primarily act mentally and keep one alert and talkative.

varieties.name: Kelai (Vanuatu)
varieties.description: Very popular for social situations. Lifts mood and encourages conversation.

varieties.name: Melo Melo (Vanuatu)
varieties.description: Slightly euphoric, ideal for social evenings.

varieties.name: Pouni Ono (Tonga)
varieties.description: Premium quality, known for its mood-lifting effects.

varieties.name: Moi (Hawaii)
varieties.description: Hawaiian variety, gently euphoric and socially opening.

tip.title: Chemotype Tip for Social Effects
tip.text: Look for Kavain (4) in positions 1-2 and Yangonin (6) in the front range. This combination provides the best mood-lifting effect. Avoid varieties that are very DHK-heavy (2 in position 1), as these tend to be sedating.

anwendung.title: Practical Application
anwendung.intro: For social occasions and mood enhancement, there are some recommendations:

setting.title: The Setting Makes the Difference
setting.intro: The effect of Kava is strongly influenced by the setting. For optimal social and mood-lifting effects:

items.label: Atmosphere:
items.value: Relaxed environment, dim lighting, pleasant music

items.label: Activity:
items.value: Conversations, listening to music, nature experiences

items.label: Mindset:
items.value: Open and curious, not stressed or rushed

quote.text: For starting the day / focus / social activity: Heady Kava like Borogu or Kelai. Effect: mentally clear, mood-lifting. Ideal for creative work, social gatherings, nature experiences.
